translation: Ratnagarbha Heavenly Maiden Dhāraṇī Dharma

source_sentence: 爾時三十三天主摩醯首羅天王。
translation: It was then that the Trāyastriṃśa god Mahêśvara praised the name of the treasury god king Ṛṣṭhrakarṇa with a crowd of goddesses.

source_sentence: 共諸天女眾讚寶藏天王名吒羅佉。
translation: Together with a multitude of goddesses, they praised the treasury god king named Tārakôttara.

source_sentence: 有大威德色力無比能於世間行殊勝事。
translation: "He has great authority and form that's unsurpassed, and he can do extraordinary things in the world.
It resembles the heavens and moves the earth, tilting mountains and covering seas.
He achieves victory in battle and defeat in will.
His wealth, money, and gold treasure are like mountains.
It's enjoyed by the world.
He then spoke the mantra, saying.

source_sentence: 唵吒羅佉吒羅佉毘多羅儞莎嚩訶
translation: "Om ṭṭrakharaṭrakhara-vetra-nee sahāvahā.
"If he wants to receive and uphold this teaching.
First, you must draw the form of a woman.

source_sentence: 泥檀法五月五日前七日。
translation: On the seventh day before the fifth day of the fifth month, the nirdeśa dharma is practiced.
He takes a long meal of reverential rice gruel.
Where he wants to go, he must purify it.

source_sentence: 凡行此法天女不喚自來。
translation: Anyone who does this ritual will have the goddess come to them on her own without being called.
Still, it's necessary to consider its use to show utmost sincerity.

source_sentence: 此法必須五月五日夜受持即果成就。
translation: This dharma must be maintained on the night of the fifth day of the fifth month for its fruit to be accomplished.
On the night of the fifth day of the fifth month.

source_sentence: 注想思存換換誦呪一千八遍。
translation: He must focus his thoughts, contemplate his retention, and recite the mantra 1,800 times in succession.
He must not hurry.
When the third watch of the night arrives, his mind seems drowsy.

source_sentence: 天女使諸女來令相試弄。
translation: The goddess sends her maidens to try to get them to play with each other.
They mustn't talk to each other.
When he reaches the second recitation, the goddess ḍārikā comes to see him.

source_sentence: 其天女吒羅佉自來相見。
translation: Then the goddess ḍārakha herself comes to meet him.
The Dharma practitioner couldn't go there.

source_sentence: 便[跍*月]跪合掌頂禮兩拜。
translation: He then [drops his head], kneels down, joins his palms, and salutes him twice.
He then asked them what they needed.
The Dharma practitioner then answered them casually.
"I'm asking for good medicine, long life, immortality, and supernormal powers.
He'll help with all the affairs of the world.
He'll serve them for the rest of his life.
The goddess wanted to give birth to her wish to be husband and wife.
The goddess was overjoyed when she heard that.
That night, they'll have intercourse with each other as they wish.
"If they want to be sisters, they must be clear about what's going on and not have doubts.

source_sentence: 於事必須分明勿生狐疑。
translation: You must be very clear about this and not have misgivings about it.

source_sentence: 其壇法二肘半量用牛糞泥地。
translation: For the altar, two and a half elbows of cow-dung and mud are used as the floor.
He also coats the ground with scented mud.

source_sentence: 五色彩畫又五色綵各二尺一寸。
translation: Five colors are painted on the ground, and five colors of ribbon are placed 2 feet 1 inch apart.
Inside the altar, he places the seat of the goddess.
There's a dish of sweet cream and other confections.
Five flower cakes of each of the five colors are placed on the altar.

source_sentence: 已雜栗麥燒花隨意供養。
translation: They are mixed with chestnut and barley, and flowers are burned to make offerings as desired.

source_sentence: 其畫像法天女身長二尺五寸。
translation: Her portrait of the goddess of the Dharma has a body 2 feet, 5 inches long.

source_sentence: 頭作花冠所點花極妙端正。
translation: Her head was crowned with flowers, and the flowers she wore were extremely delicate and straightforward.
She's wearing a purple robe with a gold belt and black boots.
In her right hand, she's holding a lotus flower.
In her left hand, she's holding a wish-granting jewel.
The goddess is perfectly radiant.
There's no painter in the world who can paint her.
He must be a good painter who can't negotiate prices.
At the appropriate time, she's permeated by spirits, and her mind and spirit are at ease.
Their wealth and possessions overflow, and their official position is highly elevated.
All woes and fortune are fully comprehended in her midst.
Noble and base people, both men and women, are delighted.

source_sentence: 凡有所動一切鬼神皆來迎待如敬天官。
translation: Whenever there's movement, all the spirits come to greet and treat them like venerating a heavenly officer.
They're frightened and venerate them, and then they attain unhinderedness.

source_sentence: 乃至世間好妙藝隨意而成。
translation: Even the world's good and marvelous arts are created at will.
Whenever evil comes to harm them, they'll call out to the thieves and each will be able to bind themselves.

source_sentence: 便呼賊各皆得自縛自打。
translation: They then call out to the thieves, and each can bind and beat themselves.

source_sentence: 言放即放世間走失死亡如驗。
translation: When he says "release," he's releasing the world from loss and death as he experiences it.

source_sentence: 目前萬病舉意持之皆差。
translation: When he holds it with his mind, all of the present illnesses will go away.

source_sentence: 又八真言各須清淨沐浴著新淨衣。
translation: Each of the other eight true words must be purified, bathed, and dressed in fresh, clean clothing.

source_sentence: 於佛前形像前各誦三七遍。
translation: He recites them three or seven times each in front of an image of the Buddha.
Then, he performs the ritual.
The first true saying.

source_sentence: 唵興婆羅帝吒急急娑嚩(二合)賀
translation: Om hyeongbharatīṭa kyui kyui svāhā
second true statement

source_sentence: 唵拔羅帝吒唎摩那羅娑嚩賀
translation: (Skt. oṃbhara-dhara-saṃghârāma)
third true word

source_sentence: 唵勒叉那帝吒娑吒娑嚩(二合)賀
translation: Om lekṣa nadīṭa sāṭasahasrāvatī
fourth true word

source_sentence: 唵婆婆隷若帝吒娑嚩(二合)賀
translation: Om bhagavat, joradīṭa, svāhag, (2) ha
fifth true word

source_sentence: 唵勃惹羅帝吒娑嚩(二合)賀
translation: Om prakṛtiṣṭha svāhā (2) he
sixth true word

source_sentence: 唵藥叉藥叉底那婆娑嚩(二合)賀
translation: oṃyakṣa-yakṣa-dināsana-vaśavartin (b.) ha
seventh true word

source_sentence: 唵遮帝毘折曳吽泮吒娑嚩(二合)賀第八真言唵折勒那耶利婆帝吒娑嚩(二合)賀以中指無名指屈。
translation: Om Śattivijayagiri Unpamṭa Sahava (binary) He The eighth true dhāraṇī is Om Śelāna yarīpatīṭa Sahava (binary) He bends his middle finger and ring finger.
With his big toe, he presses his two fingernails together.
He extends his forefinger and little finger to rest his chest.
With his right hand, he holds several balls in his hand and recites the true chant.
This is called the jade ring seal.
After the ritual for the jeweled goddess, he said.
